title: Which F1 teams have the best 2026 livery? Our writers decide
author: DIVEBOMB Motorsport
description: With all 11 F1 teams having unveiled their 2026 liveries, our writers decide which outfits have the most eye-catching designs to mark the start of a new era for the sport.

title: Simply the “bez”: Bezzecchi‘s exceptional 2025 season
author: Isabel Jane Caporaso
description: The 2025 MotoGP season was filled with outstanding comebacks and incredible revelations. In a year full of new discoveries, perhaps the most pleasant one was Marco Bezzecchi. The 27-year-old Italian took part in his first season with Aprilia Racing, finishing in a solid third position in the standings. In this article, we revisit his impressive season.

title: José Garfias confirmed at PREMA for 2026 Formula 3 Season
author: Liam Ploetner
description: After yesterday’s announcement that Enzo Deligny would be moving from Prema to Van Amersfoort ahead of the 2026 F3 season, PREMA announced Deligny’s replacement will be Mexican driver José Garfias.

title: Aston Martin 2026 Car Launch: A timeless take on a new era
author: Mia Wallace
description: Aston Martin was the final team to reveal their 2026 livery, ahead of the first public test set to begin this week in Bahrain.

title: McLaren 2026 Car Launch: Continuity, identity and intent
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: McLaren unveiled the MCL40 in Bahrain, reinforcing continuity through papaya, a settled driver pairing, and clear intent as F1 resets for 2026.

title: David Malukas exclusive: “This is going to be my own legacy”
author: Archie O’Reilly
description: Two years ago, David Malukas was facing a possible career-ending injury. But now in 2026, he is gearing up to debut for Team Penske as Will Power's replacement.

title: Daniil Kvyat set for GT3 debut with JLOC in Super GT
author: Tarun Suresh
description: Daniil Kvyat recently announced he will race in Super GT with JLOC.

title: Step-by-step: CLX Motorsport’s path from Le Mans Cup to LMP2
author: Ghazlan Atqiya Firmansyah

title: DKR Engineering wins the 4 Hours of Abu Dhabi Race 2, CrowdStrike Racing seals the LMP2 title
author: Ghazlan Atqiya Firmansyah
description: DKR Engineering won the final race of the 2025–26 Asian Le Mans Series, the 4 Hours of Abu Dhabi Race 2. The champions of LMP2, LMP3 and GT are finally crowned under the lights of Yas Marina.

author: Vyas Ponnuri

title: O'Ward on "competitive" IndyCar field and 2026 title fight
author: Morgan Holiday

author: Dan Jones
description: The battle between Mick Schumacher, Dennis Hauger and Caio Collet for IndyCar's Rookie of the Year award is seen as one of the most hotly contested classes for the award in recent memory. DIVEBOMB delves into what they said at IndyCar Content Days as they preview their rookie seasons.

title: Winners and Losers: Miami E-Prix
author: Vyas Ponnuri

title: CrowdStrike Racing wins the 4 Hours of Abu Dhabi Race 1 with WRT taking 1–2 in GT
author: Ghazlan Atqiya Firmansyah

title: Williams’ absence in Barcelona may not be the end: How the team can still rebound

description: After being the only team to miss the Barcelona shakedown, many are speculating that Williams have dug themselves a hole too deep to crawl out of. Is it truly the end for a team that delivered promising results last season, or are they set to defy the odds?

title: No.5 United Autosports starts on pole for the 4 Hours of Abu Dhabi finale
author: Ghazlan Atqiya Firmansyah

On one hand, he secured two podiums at Detroit and Road America; the most for AJ Foyt Enterprises for over a decade since Takuma Sato back in 2013. On the other, he scored almost 100 less points than the year prior and was beaten by his teammate David Malukas who was eventually poached by Team Penske.

title: Enzo Deligny leaves Prema for Van Amersfoort Racing, replaces Jesse Carrasquedo Jr

author: Teagan Crump
description: Formula E’s newest race venue, the Miami International Autodrome, made for an interesting race that featured some dramatic moments, leaving fans and pundits wondering if the move to Miami was the right call for the championship. Teagan looks at five major takeaways from the race weekend in Miami

title: The McLaren Artura GT4 faces the chopping block as the British marque focuses on GT3 and one-make series’

description: At a glance – save for the obvious livery differences – the three Porsche 963 GTP entrants that lined up on the grid for the 2026 Daytona 24 Hours were all but identical. However, the No.85 JDC-Miller MotorSports entry found itself at a disadvantage compared to the No.6 and No.7 Porsche Penske Motorsport contenders before the green flag had even dropped.

Names such as Kevin Magnussen, Álex Palou, Jack Aitken, Connor Zilisch, Colton Herta, Scott Dixon and many many more will all be looking to head home with a brand new Rolex, and a Daytona 24 Hours victory to their name.

description: Ford Racing has announced its first three drivers ahead of its 2027 Hypercar debut alongside the engine that will power their ORECA prototype.

description: Ferrari reshuffles Hamilton’s garage as Riccardo Adami exits the pit wall, ending a fraught partnership ahead of F1’s regulation-reset 2026 season.

author: Meghana Sree
description: Luke Browning will take up F1 reserve driver duties for Williams in 2026, while also competing in the Japanese Super Formula Championship following a switch from F2.

author: DIVEBOMB Motorsport
description: Red Bull and Racing Bulls launched their 2026 liveries ahead of the upcoming Formula One season. The event took place in Detroit, Michigan, the home of Ford which was celebrated last night in front of the 1,500 capacity audience.

title: Who leaves the Mexico City E-Prix happy?
author: Teagan Crump
description: Formula E’s Mexico City E-Prix will have left several drivers experiencing different emotions. Some drivers were elated, while others shared their annoyance and frustration, even on social media. Nick Cassidy’s win showed that, despite being the new team on the grid, Citroën could pull off some strong performances to match their established contenders.

title: McLaren lock in Fornaroli and O’Ward as Reserve Drivers for 2026
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: McLaren name F2 champion Leonardo Fornaroli and IndyCar star Pato O’Ward as reserve drivers for 2026 strengthening depth for a new F1 era ahead now.

title: The IMSA gauntlet: Why Daytona is Porsche's first true test of focus
author: Ghazlan Atqiya Firmansyah
description: Porsche's entire prototype effort is on the line in IMSA. The 963 will start its most scrutinised season at Daytona.

title: Woman Spotlight Wednesday: Rachel Robertson
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: Late starter Rachel Robertson rockets from rental karts to F1 Academy, mastering every challenge with fierce skill, speed, and unshakeable resilience.

title: When will F1 teams launch their 2026 cars? All the dates, details and timings
author: Meghana Sree
description: Everything you need to know about each F1 team’s car launch ahead of the 2026 season with new technical regulations.

title: Ayhancan Güven to drive for Porsche in Miami Rookie Free Practice session
author: Teagan Crump
description: Written by Teagan Crump, Edited by Vyas Ponnuri Porsche Formula E team have announced that they will reunite with Turkish driver Ayhancan Güven for the Formula E Rookie Free Practice session at the Miami E-Prix. The 28-year-old will be driving the Porsche 99X Electric during the session on Friday, January 30, ahead of the race weekend. Credit: Porsche AG The rookie practice is a mandatory 40-minute session for all ten teams in the all-electric racing series. Drivers involved

title: Six bold predictions for the 2026 F1 season
author: DIVEBOMB Motorsport
description: Our writers give six bold predictions for the 2026 F1 season – including maiden victories and new teams making a splash.

title: Alpine and Doohan mutually part ways ahead of 2026
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: Jack Doohan and Alpine part ways by mutual agreement, ending the Australian driver’s Formula One stint ahead of the 2026 season.

title: Five takeaways from the Mexico City E-Prix
author: Teagan Crump
description: Last weekend’s Mexico City E-Prix showed that several new storylines are developing in Season 12 of Formula E. Up and down the grid, Mexico City proved to be a challenge and provided some surprising results. Here are five vital storylines following on from the E-Prix.

title: Cassidy stuns the field to take maiden victory for Citroën in Mexico City
author: Vyas Ponnuri
description: Nick Cassidy took his first victory of Season 12, and put Citroën Racing's name up on the winners board for the first time. The New Zealander pulled off a stellar defence late in the race at Mexico, fending off a charging Edoardo Mortara and Oliver Rowland until the flag.

title: Formula E Preview: Mexico City
author: Vyas Ponnuri
description: After an exciting and attritious season opener in São Paulo that threw up more surprises than you’d have expected, the mantle now shifts upwards in the Americas. Mexico City becomes the next venue to be in the spotlight, with a new layout, a landmark for the series and a highly competitive Formula E grid expected to put on a show!

title: The state at Foyt: Ferrucci’s stability, Collet’s IndyCar step & NXT expansion

As the teams and drivers prepare themselves to traverse Mexico and the ever-vibrant Foro Sol stadium in the second race weekend of the year, there’s plenty on the line.

author: Isha Reshmi Mohan
description: The upcoming MotoGP season has implemented an engine freeze rule before the next big move to 850cc bikes in 2027. Here is all you need to know about this and why Yamaha will be exempt from the rule.

title: F4 2025 Season Recap: Continental European Championships

title: 2026 Super GT GT500 driver lineups explained
author: Tarun Suresh

title: McLaren End of Year Report: A circuitous route to both championships

description: Mercedes finished runners up to McLaren in the 2025 World Constructors’ Championship, but it’s title success they’re aiming for in 2026. Here’s their end of year report.

author: Kavi Khandelwal

author: Caitlyn Gordon
description: Ferrari had a rocky season, with many lows and few highs, as the Prancing Horse struggled throughout 2025. Hope set high expectations, but reality soon sank in as Ferrari began slipping behind its competitors. Here's their end of year report.

title: Williams End of Year Report: Climbing back up the order
author: Chloe Buckley
description: For Williams, 2025 was a significant step forward as the team climbed to fifth in the Constructors’ Championship. With more consistency and less errors compared to the last few seasons, Williams outscored their mid-field rivals to secure their best championship result in eight years. Here's their end of year report.

title: F4 2025 Season Recap: National European Championships – France and Great Britain

description: Over the course of the season, Racing Bulls climbed their way up the mid-field ranks. Here’s their end of year report.

title: Woman Spotlight Wednesday: Ella Stevens
author: Annalise Huang
description: Ella Stevens is an exciting, young female talent, whose karting successes preface her upcoming 2026 F1 Academy campaign.

author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: Haas battled a flawed car but grew stronger throughout the year, supported by sharp drivers, steady leadership and late-season grit laying the groundwork for a bolder 2026. Here’s their end of year report.

description: The 2025 MotoGP season delivered extremes: for some riders, surprise breakthroughs and career-defining campaigns; for others, frustration, injury or unmet expectations. description: Alpine have endured a desolate 2025 F1 season plagued with an underperforming car, controversial driver management and their worst ever finish in the Constructors’ standings at 10th. Here’s their end of year report.

Max Verstappen starts on pole, Lando Norris in second only needs a podium to win his maiden title and Oscar Piastri isn't out of contention just yet. title: F1 partnerships that will end at the 2025 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix

author: Jasmin Low
description: Written by Jasmin Low After taking his maiden Formula 2 Feature Race victory in Abu Dhabi in 2024, Joshua Dürksen repeated his heroics in 2025, taking the final race victory of the season for AIX Racing after starting eighth on the grid. A dramatic Feature Race brought the 2025 F2 season to a close | Credit: Formula 2 via X Roman Staněk delivered a sublime performance in qualifying to claim his second pole of the season, topping the timesheets just 0.087 seconds ahead of Jak

title: PREVIEW: Can Porsche defend their Formula E title in 2026?

title: PREVIEW: Can Jaguar return to the top of Formula E once again?

title: PREVIEW: Is Season 12 the start of Mahindra’s Formula E revival?

title: Five storylines ahead of the São Paulo E-Prix

description: With Season 12 of Formula E getting underway this weekend in São Paulo, there are many storylines developing and shaping the season. DIVEBOMB takes a look into the biggest stories ahead of the first race weekend......

author: Peter Johnson

title: PREVIEW: Can Envision Racing bounce back for a stronger Season 12?

title: PREVIEW: DS PENSKE set for a resurgent Formula E season
author: Lucrezia Marano
description: In the lead-up to Formula E’s Season 12, DIVEBOMB’s writers preview the season ahead for each of the 10 teams taking part in the all-electric racing series. The fifth part of this series looks at a team aiming to go bigger with an exciting line-up in 2026…..

title: Robb to return to Juncos Hollinger for 2026

description: In the lead-up to Formula E's Season 12, DIVEBOMB's writers preview the season ahead for each of the 10 teams taking part in the all-electric racing series. The second part of this series looks at a team aiming to build on a solid debut campaign.

title: “Total, utter nonsense”: Wolff rejects claims that Antonelli gifted Norris a place

Walkinshaw Andretti United was involved in its fair share of highs and lows in a dramatic end to the

The session gave teams and drivers a final chance to prepare for the first qualifying session of the weekend, which would precede the newly instated evening race, which offers $50,000 and 50 points to the victor.  The sky darkened over the streets of Adelaide as Practice 2 got underway | Credit: Jasmin Low As it Happened The session got off to a frenetic start, with

title: Woman Spotlight Wednesday: Katharina Nowak
author: Aashna Singh
description: Katharina Nowak is the new President of the Miami Grand Prix, becoming the youngest ever F1 race president at 28 and one of only two women in the role globally.

title: The 2025 F1 Academy season so far: Everything you need to know ahead of Las Vegas
author: Meghana Sree
description: From championship battles to rookie rivalries, here’s everything you need to know ahead of 2025’s final F1 Academy round in Las Vegas.

title: The 58-point swing: How Norris reversed his F1 title fortunes
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: From 34 points down to 24 up. This is how Lando Norris engineered a 58-point swing to take control of the 2025 F1 Drivers' Championship.

title: Christian Lundgaard exclusive: Falling in love with IndyCar & driving for McLaren
author: Archie O’Reilly
description: Christian Lundgaard made the decision to move to IndyCar over four years ago. This is the story of how he has grown into one of the series' greatest prospects.

title: Porsche to run four factory cars, set up additional Formula E entry from 2027
author: Vyas Ponnuri
description: Reigning Constructors' champions Porsche have officially confirmed their decision to run four factory cars from the upcoming Gen4 era in 2027, effectively setting up a junior team to provide a pathway to help nurture and raise junior talent in Formula E.

title: Feeder Series Weekly Recap: McLaren mix-up their junior lineup, driver signings and more
author: DIVEBOMB Motorsport
description: Written by Jasmin Low Welcome to Feeder Series Weekly Recap, a series bringing you all the news from the world of junior racing series. With driver signings in both F3 and F2, as well as changes to McLaren’s junior lineup, DIVEBOMB takes you through all the latest from the world of Feeder Series in the last week.  Nikola Tsolov set to make Formula 2 debut with Campos at Qatar Red Bull Protégé Nikola Tsolov with graduate to Formula 2 for the final two rounds of the 2025 season

title: Closing Act With A Twist: An Aprilia Showcase in the Final Race of the Year
author: Ramiza Donlic
description: Written by Ramiza Donlic Marco Bezzecchi claimed the last race win of the 2025 season I Credits: Gold & Goose The 2025 season of MotoGP concluded at the Circuit Ricardo Tormo in Valencia with Marco Bezzecchi sealing the deal - closely followed by Raúl Fernández for Trackhouse and Fabio Di Quartararo for VR46. Pedro Acosta came close to the podium but ultimately finished fourth for KTM, with Fermín Aldeguer in fifth and newly crowned runner-up in the clampionship Álex Márquez

title: 2025 Macau Grand Prix Recap
author: Lorenzo Baer
description: Check out a summary of the exciting events that composed the 72nd Macau Grand Prix weekend

title: 2025 Macau Grand Prix: Grassroots Formula in the spotlight
author: Lorenzo Baer
description: With two grassroots formulae categories on its programme for 2025, Macau once again promises to be a showcase for young talents in world motorsport

title: Unpacking F1 Commission's 2026 roadmap
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: Going inside F1's plans for 2026: including a new 55% livery rule to end bare carbon, discussions on mandatory two-stops and flexible driver numbers.

title: IndyCar Weekly: Done deals, development programmes and Daytona
author: Dan Jones
description: Dan gives you the round-up of all IndyCar and Indy NXT news between the 9th and 15th of November including Indy 500 signings, contract renewals and even more testing

title: “I love pressure” - Kanaan relishing Arrow McLaren IndyCar project
author: Archie O’Reilly
description: Tony Kanaan became the figurehead of the Arrow McLaren IndyCar project earlier this year. He is relishing the pressure of leading the team.

title: How F1’s 2025 rookies have been the most impressive class since 2019's rookies
author: Caitlyn Gordon
description: Six rookies took the leap into Formula One for the 2025 season, with Oliver Bearman, Kimi Antonelli, Isack Hadjar, Gabriel Bortoleto, Liam Lawson and Franco Colapinto jumping up to the pinnacle of motorsport after they each took their own respective success in the 2024 Formula 2 season and other junior series.

title: Inside Arrow McLaren’s Hunter-Reay Indy 500 signing
author: Archie O’Reilly
description: After the agony of a near miss earlier this year, Ryan Hunter-Reay is back for an 18th Indy 500 attempt next year - this time with Arrow McLaren. This is how the deal came about...

title: Five Winners, Five Losers: São Paulo Grand Prix
author: Peter Johnson
description: Lando Norris made significant strides in the Drivers’ Championship in Brazil, but who else had a landmark week at Interlagos?

title: Hunter-Reay confirmed for Indy 500 return with Arrow McLaren
author: Dan Jones
description: Ryan Hunter-Reay has been confirmed for an Indianapolis 500 return as he races with Arrow McLaren for the 'Greatest Spectacle in Racing'

title: MotoGP 2025 Valencian Grand Prix: Preview
author: Finn Glover
description: For one final time in a season of utter remarkability, chaos and in some parts, total domination, the field of 22 will take to the racetrack this weekend for the return of the beloved Valencian Grand Prix.

title: Five Takeaways: São Paulo Grand Prix
author: Elaina Russell
description: Lando Norris tightened his grip on the title with a dominant victory in São Paulo. Meanwhile, Kimi Antonelli collected two podiums, Ferrari collapsed and tempers flared further down the order.

title: F1 Academy confirm full F1 team support for 2026, Cadillac to join as sponsor in 2027
author: Meghana Sree
description: In a series of major updates, F1 Academy has confirmed the continued support of all 10 Formula One teams for the 2026 season. Cadillac, making its F1 debut next year, will join the F1 Academy grid in 2027.

title: 2025 Macau Grand Prix Preview
author: Lorenzo Baer
description: The Macau Grand Prix is the jewel of the Orient when it comes to motor racing. In terms of tradition, few races in that part of the world can rival Macau, with the glamour and danger involved in every turn of the legendary Guia circuit. The scene of so many stories, the race returns for its 72nd edition in 2025 stronger than ever and offering attractions for all tastes.

title: Jack Aitken joins JOTA Cadillac for 2026 WEC season, replacing Jenson Button
author: Owen Bradley
description: Jack Aitken will race for Hertz Team Jota Cadillac in the 2026 World Endurance Championship, replacing motorsport legend Jenson Button.

title: Fermín Aldeguer’s 2025 MotoGP season — A breakout year for Ducati’s young star
author: Aaratrika Gupta
description: MotoGP has seen several breakout stars during its storied tenure, and the 2025 season marked the rise of Fermin Aldeguer, who claimed his maiden MotoGP victory earlier this year. The Spaniard came off several Moto2 campaigns that were well pieced together, along the way.

title: Winners and Losers: MotoGP 2025 Portugal Grand Prix
author: Isha Reshmi Mohan
description: Marco Bezzecchi comfortably took his win at Portimao, but there was no shortage of action behind him, with plenty of battles, a strong showing from the KTM factory team, and setbacks for riders like Morbidelli and Bagnaia, who crashed. Here are the winners and losers from the Portuguese Grand Prix.

title: How Jay Frye is leading RLL’s IndyCar team forward
author: Archie O’Reilly
description: Jay Frye joined RLL as team president in April after losing his position as IndyCar president less than two months earlier. He is already having a significant influence on the team.

title: Manthey's "perfect strategy" secured the LMGT3 titles in Bahrain — Hardwick
author: Ghazlan Atqiya Firmansyah
description: Manthey Racing fought their way from the back of the LMGT3 grid to finish fourth during the 8 Hours of Bahrain, securing both championships.

title: "I did not expect that at all": Verstappen stuns with pit lane-to-podium charge despite puncture
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: Max Verstappen called his São Paulo P3 "incredible," charging from the pit lane despite a puncture. "I did not expect that at all."

title: Antonelli fends off "stressful" Verstappen charge for career-best P2 in São Paulo
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: Kimi Antonelli capped a P2 Sprint with a career-best P2 GP. He survived restart contact and fended off a "stressful" Max charge.

title: Piastri following his 10-second penalty in São Paulo: "I can't disappear but the decision is what it is."
author: Chloe Buckley
description: In São Paulo, Oscar Piastri received a 10-second pentalty following a bump with Kimi Antonelli. The driver reacted to the decision following the race.

title: Norris following his impressive victory in Brazil: “Just ignore everyone that talks c**p about you!”
author: Chloe Buckley
description: Following an impressive victory at the São Paulo Grand Prix, Lando Norris spoke to the media about his mentality going forward.

title: "It was 50-50": Leclerc defends Piastri after restart crash ended his São Paulo Grand Prix
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: After a "frustrating" DNF in São Paulo, Charles Leclerc says the crash was a "50-50" incident and Oscar Piastri didn't deserve full blame.

title: Verstappen storms to P3 from the pit lane as Norris wins dramatic São Paulo Grand Prix
author: Meghana Sree
description: Lando Norris took a dominant victory in São Paulo to cap a clean-sweep weekend, while Max Verstappen charged through the field to third from the pit lane, missing out on second to Mercedes rookie Kimi Antonelli.

title: Bezzecchi takes a smooth victory at Portimão
author: Isha Reshmi Mohan
description: Marco Bezzecchi gets a smooth win at the Portuguese Grand Prix before we head into the final race of the 2025 season. Here’s all the action from Portugal with even mid field battles between Àlex Márquez, Pedro Acosta, Ai Ogura, Fabio Quartararo, Brad Binder and many more.

title: Policand: "Hugely satisfying" — ASP Lexus converted their pole to second WEC win at Bahrain
author: Ghazlan Atqiya Firmansyah
description: ASP Lexus ends their second WEC season with a pole and a strong victory at the 8 Hours of Bahrain.

title: A mixed up grid, Verstappen fighting from the pit lane and Norris on pole: What to expect in the São Paulo Grand Prix
author: Meghana Sree
description: A qualifying full of thrilling twists and turns set the mixed up starting order for race day in São Paulo, complete with Max Verstappen starting from the pit lane, Oscar Piastri in fourth and Lando Norris on pole. Here’s everything to look out for in what is sure to be another dramatic São Paulo Grand Prix.

title: "A reward for everyone": Toyota ends difficult WEC season with a 1–2 finish in Bahrain
author: Ghazlan Atqiya Firmansyah
description: Toyota's 1–2 finish at the 8 Hours of Bahrain was "a reward for everyone" after a season full of setbacks and struggles.

title: IndyCar Weekly: Contracts confirmed and champions crowned
author: Dan Jones
description: Dan gives you the round-up of IndyCar and Indy NXT news between the 2nd and 8th November including key contracts, champions being crowned and even more silly season.

title: Norris takes pole in Brazil as Verstappen endures a shock Q1 exit
author: Charlotte Mui
description: A recap of a surprising qualifying in Brazil, that saw Verstappen out in Q1.

title: Verstappen says he cannot “understand how it can be this bad” after shock Q1 elimination in São Paulo qualifying
author: Maham Mir
description: Reigning world champion Max Verstappen discusses his shock Q1 elimination and the performance of his Red Bull.

title: Ferrari seal 1-2-3 in WEC drivers championship as Toyota get 1-2 in 8 Hours of Bahrain. Porsche win title in LMGT3
author: Aaron Carroll
description: Ferrari have sealed a 1-2-3 finish in the World Endurance Championship (WEC) drivers championship, and the manufacturers title. Toyota took a 1-2 in the 8 Hours of Bahrain, while the No.87 Lexus won in LMGT3 and the No.92 Porsche took that title.

title: Bortoleto unable to take part in São Paulo qualifying after high-speed crash in sprint
author: Caitlyn Gordon
description: Gabriel Bortoleto suffered a 57g crash during the São Paulo Sprint race, the damage meant he was unable to participate in Qualifying.

title: Bearman and Lawson penalised after São Paulo sprint incident for "dangerous driving"
author: Maham Mir
description: Ollie Bearman and Liam Lawson have been given time penalties and points on their licence following an incident in the São Paulo sprint.

title: Oscar Piastri explains 'silly mistake' which caused Sprint race crash
author: Caitlyn Gordon
description: Oscar Piastri is determined to rewrite his weekend and quickly move on from his Sprint race crash, which resulted in the Australian dropping nine points behind teammate Lando Norris.

title: Norris wins hectic São Paulo sprint as rival Piastri crashes out
author: Maham Mir
description: Lando Norris took sprint victory from pole in an interrupted session that saw title rival Oscar Piastri crash out after running in third, while Mercedes scored a double podium led by Kimi Antonelli.

title: LIVE: WEC 8 Hours of Bahrain
author: DIVEBOMB Sportscars Team
description: Welcome to DIVEBOMB's LIVE coverage of the World Endurance Championship finale, the 8 Hours of Bahrain. Both Hypercar and LMGT3 championships will be decided today, with the race getting underway at 10:00 GMT.

title: One last race: Jenson Button hangs up his helmet
author: Kavi Khandelwal
description: From F1 Champion to endurance racer, Jenson Button's legendary racing career is set to end this weekend. DIVEBOMB takes a look back at the "gentleman racer's" inspiring motorsport journey ahead of his final race in Bahrain.

title: Jenson Button on 'emotional' final race in motorsport career ahead of WEC Bahrain 8 Hours
author: DIVEBOMB Sportscars Team
description: Written by Owen Bradley Credit: James Moy Photography Jenson Button will retire from professional racing after this weekend's WEC Bahrain 8 Hours. The 2009 Formula One World Champion spoke to DIVEBOMB Motorsport about his decision to finally hang up the helmet, as we reflect on the Brit's remarkable career. Rolex Testimonee Jenson Button revealed exclusively to DIVEBOMB: “This race will be very emotional. I’ve had a very long career in professional racing and didn’t think I’d

title: Piastri feeling “much happier” in Brazil compared to the last couple of weeks
author: Chloe Buckley
description: Following the sprint qualifying at the São Paulo Grand Prix, Oscar Piastri spoke to the media about his session.

title: Norris takes sprint pole in São Paulo
author: Jason Sharp
description: A rundown of sprint qualifying for the Sao Paulo Grand Prix.

title: Norris tops practice for the São Paulo Grand Prix
author: Jason Sharp
description: A run down of the sole practice session ahead of the 2025 Sao Paulo Grand Prix.

title: Toyota lock out front row for WEC finale in Bahrain
author: Aaron Carroll
description: Toyota locked out the front row for the finale, with the No.7 starting ahead of the No.8. Then came a Peugeot 3-4, ahead of the No.12 Cadillac. The championship leading No.51 will be seventh, with the No.83 just outside the top 10 and the No.6 Porsche starting dead last.

title: Colapinto to remain at Alpine for 2026
author: Elaina Russell
description: Franco Colapinto will remain with Alpine for the 2026 Formula One season, the team has confirmed ahead of the São Paulo Grand Prix.
